alert.note: Alert for Potter (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 05 at 8:16PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: .Steady showers continue to bring heavy rainfall to southern Potter County, where more than 2.5 inches of rain has already fallen. Additional rainfall could result in more significant flooding. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following county, Potter. * WHEN...Until 1015 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 814 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall of 0.5 to 1 inches is expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ole Bull State Park and Cross Fork. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
